bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names yong qi 壅氣 , obstruction qi.

① Etiological Agent. of qi that cannot move freely in the body and may cause disease. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 12: 五臟滯氣，積聚不消，壅閉不通，心腹脹滿 . “When the five depots have sluggish qi , which accumulates and collects and fails to be dissolved, with blockage and failure of passage, then heart and abdomen will be affected by distension and a feeling of fullness”.

②A side effect of pharmaceutical substances blocking the qi dynamics in the body. Ben cao yan yi 本草衍義 Substance Entry li 栗：小兒不可多食，生者難化，熟即滯氣 , “Children must not eat too much. [If consumed] raw it is difficult to digest. [If consumed] prepared it causes sluggish qi ”. Zhi quan 猘犬 , rabid dog [31]
Identical with kuang quan 狂犬 . Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 7 lists recipes 療猘犬咬人方 , “To cure people bitten by a rabid dog ”. Zhi re 痔熱 , piles that are hot [1]
Illness Sign of a feeling of hot zhi chuang 痔瘡 , piles sores. FRDYLF 8: kuo yu 蛞蝓： 療痔熱腫痛 , “It heals piles that are hot, swollen, and painful”.
